original: gzhan la rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / ma byin par @194b len pa spangs pa dang / bla ma rnams la gus par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / mngon du ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyor zhing 'dud pa'i las byas pas gzhan dag gi yid mgu bar byas pa dang /

original: las gsum po gang dag gis skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gsum po gang dag bstan pa de dag thams cad mtha' dag gis ni zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa brnyes so //

original: de la mtshan gsum po dag brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mtshan gsum po dag brten pa'i phyir ro //

original: bla ma rnams la snum bsku ba dang mnye ba dang / dril ba dang / khrus dang / gos byin pas ni phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa brnyes so //

original: ji lta ba bzhin du chos blangs shing kun chub par byas nas /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du chos blangs shing kun chub par byas nas /
translated: By receiving the dharmas as they are and mastering them,

analyzed: gzhan dag la bstan pa dang / gzhan dag gis 'phrin pa legs par byas pas ni byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bu brnyes so //

translated: He obtained the even

analyzed: 'bur med pa brnyes pa de nyid kyis ni sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa brnyes so //
translated: By that very attainment of the absence of depressions, he attained the hairs of the body that point upward.

original: bdag nyid kyis dge ba spyad pa dang / mkhas pa dang / shes pha la brten pa dang / cha phra ba'i don la sems pa dang / bla ma rnams kyi gnas byi dor byas pa dang / mnye zhing dril ba dang / khrus byas te gcig pur gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis dge ba spyad pa dang / mkhas pa dang / shes pha la brten pa dang / cha phra ba'i don la sems pa dang / bla ma rnams kyi gnas byi dor byas pa dang / mnye zhing dril ba dang / khrus byas te gcig pur gnas pa dang /
translated: By himself practicing virtue, by relying on the wise and the learned, by reflecting on subtle meanings, by cleaning the dwellings of the gurus, by massaging and bathing them, and by living alone,

original: bshes gnyen gcig la brten pa dang / cha phra ba'i don la 'jug pa dang / rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i nyal nyil bsal ba dang / glo bur gyi dri ma bsal bas ni spu nyag re re nas skyes shing g-yas su 'khyil pa brnyes so //

translated: by relying on a single spiritual friend, by engaging in subtle meanings, and by removing the clutter of grass, leaves, etc., and by removing adventitious stains, he attained the hairs of the body that grow singly and turn to the right.

original: yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar byed pa'i zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang ; gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad byin pa dang / khro ba med pas ni sku mdog gser 'dra ba dang 'od 'dom gang dang ldan pa brnyes so //
analyzed: yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar byed pa'i zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang ; gos dang / rgyan la sogs pa lus kyi yo byad byin pa dang / khro ba med pas ni sku mdog gser 'dra ba dang 'od 'dom gang dang ldan pa brnyes so //
translated: He gave food, drink, vehicles, clothes, ornaments, etc., which are the requisites of the body, and which are pleasing and delightful.

original: las gang gis spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil pa bstan pa de nyid kyis ni pags pa srab cing 'jam pa brnyes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las gang gis spu re re nas skye zhing g-yas su 'khyil pa bstan pa de nyid kyis ni pags pa srab cing 'jam pa brnyes par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the very same action which is indicated as the cause of the single hair growing from each follicle and curling to the right, one should understand that he obtained skin which is smooth and delicate.

original: zas dang skom mang po gya nom pa phal po ches skye bo'i tshogs mang po tshim par byas pas ni /
analyzed: zas dang skom mang po gya nom pa phal po ches skye bo'i tshogs mang po tshim par byas pas ni /
translated: By satisfying a multitude of people with a great variety of excellent food and drink,

original: sku'i bdun mtho ba brnyes so //
analyzed: sku'i bdun mtho ba brnyes so //
translated: he obtained the seven parts of his body which are well-rounded.

original: sems can rnams kyi chos kyi bya ba byung ngo cog la gtso bor gnas pa dang / nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / brlang bar mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams gnod pa las ni bzlog / phan pa la ni btsud pas sems can gyi don dag la seng ge bzhin du brtul ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas ni ro stong seng ge'i 'dra ba brnyes so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi chos kyi bya ba byung ngo cog la gtso bor gnas pa dang / nga rgyal mi byed pa dang / brlang bar mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams gnod pa las ni bzlog / phan pa la ni btsud pas sems can gyi don dag la seng ge bzhin du brtul ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas ni ro stong seng ge'i 'dra ba brnyes so //
translated: He is the foremost in all the activities of sentient beings, he is not proud, he is not rough, he turns sentient beings away from harm and introduces them to benefit. He is courageous in the welfare of sentient beings like a lion. He has obtained the chest of a lion.

original: las de kho nas ni dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang thal gong rgyas pa brnyes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las de kho nas ni dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang thal gong rgyas pa brnyes par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is by that very action that he has obtained well-developed shoulders and a broad chest.

original: las gang gis sor mo ring ba brnyes pa de nyid kyis ni sku che zhing drang ba brnyes so //
analyzed: las gang gis sor mo ring ba brnyes pa de nyid kyis ni sku che zhing drang ba brnyes so //
translated: By the very action by which he obtained long fingers, he obtained a large and straight body.

original: mdza' bshes 'byed pa'i phra ma'i tshig ni spangs sems can mi mthun pa rnams mthun par byas pas ni tshems bzhi bcu dang mnyam pa dang thags bzang ba brnyes so //
analyzed: mdza' bshes 'byed pa'i phra ma'i tshig ni spangs sems can mi mthun pa rnams mthun par byas pas ni tshems bzhi bcu dang mnyam pa dang thags bzang ba brnyes so //
translated: By abandoning divisive speech that separates friends and by reconciling those who are divided, he obtained forty even teeth and well-aligned teeth.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byams pa bsgom pa dang / chos kyi don sems pas ni chems shin tu dkar ba brnyes so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i byams pa bsgom pa dang / chos kyi don sems pas ni chems shin tu dkar ba brnyes so //
translated: He obtained the very white teeth by meditating on love in the desire realm and by reflecting on the meaning of the Dharma.

original: sems can 'dod pa rnams la ci 'dod pa'i nor legs par btang bas ni 'gram pa seng ge'i lta bu brnyes so //
analyzed: sems can 'dod pa rnams la ci 'dod pa'i nor legs par btang bas ni 'gram pa seng ge'i lta bu brnyes so //
translated: He obtained the cheeks of a lion by giving wealth to sentient beings according to their desires.

original: sems can rnams bdag gi bu bzhin du legs par bsrungs pa dang / dad pa dang ldan pa dang / snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / sman byin pa dang / dang ba dang phan pas @195b ni ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa brnyes so //
analyzed: sems can rnams bdag gi bu bzhin du legs par bsrungs pa dang / dad pa dang ldan pa dang / snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / sman byin pa dang / dang ba dang phan pas @195b ni ro bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa brnyes so //
translated: He obtained the supreme taste by properly protecting sentient beings as if they were his own children, by having faith, by having compassion, by giving medicine, and by being pure and helpful.

original: chos kyi bcud byin pa dang / chos kyi bcud kyi ro myangs pa dang / ro nyams pa bcos pa dang / srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po rnams bdag nyid kyis kyang yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: chos kyi bcud byin pa dang / chos kyi bcud kyi ro myangs pa dang / ro nyams pa bcos pa dang / srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi lnga po rnams bdag nyid kyis kyang yang dag par blangs te /
translated: He obtained the tongue of Brahmā by giving the essence of the Dharma, by experiencing the taste of the essence of the Dharma, by treating loss of taste, and by himself taking up the five precepts such as abandoning killing.

original: legs par bsrungs shing gzhan rnams kyang de dag la yang dag par btsud pa dang / snying rje'i sems la brten te chos yang dag par blang ba chen po la zhugs pas ni dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa brnyes so //
analyzed: legs par bsrungs shing gzhan rnams kyang de dag la yang dag par btsud pa dang / snying rje'i sems la brten te chos yang dag par blang ba chen po la zhugs pas ni dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / ljags ring zhing srab pa brnyes so //
translated: He attained the uṣṇīṣa on his head and the long, slender tongue by protecting these and introducing others to them, and by engaging in the great adoption of Dharma on the basis of an attitude of compassion.

original: bden par smras pa dang / snyan par smras pa dang / dus su smras pa dang / chos smras pas ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs brnyes so //
analyzed: bden par smras pa dang / snyan par smras pa dang / dus su smras pa dang / chos smras pas ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs brnyes so //
translated: He attained the Brahma voice by speaking the truth, speaking pleasantly, speaking at the appropriate time, and speaking Dharma.

original: sems can mtha' dag la pha ma bzhin du byams pa'i sems kyis snying brtse bas ni spyan mthon mthing dang rdzi ma ba'i lta bu brnyes so //
analyzed: sems can mtha' dag la pha ma bzhin du byams pa'i sems kyis snying brtse bas ni spyan mthon mthing dang rdzi ma ba'i lta bu brnyes so //
translated: He attained eyes like a deep blue lotus and eyelashes like a cow by regarding all sentient beings with a loving mind that is compassionate like a parent.

original: yon tan can rnams kyis bden pa'i bsngags pa brjod cing bsgrags pas ni smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dung gi mdog ltar dkar la g-yas su 'khyil pa brnyes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yon tan can rnams kyis bden pa'i bsngags pa brjod cing bsgrags pas ni smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu dung gi mdog ltar dkar la g-yas su 'khyil pa brnyes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: He attained the hair between his eyebrows that is like the color of a conch and curls to the right by praising and proclaiming the truth of those who have good qualities.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po thams cad kyang bye brag med par tshul khrims kyi rgyus thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po thams cad kyang bye brag med par tshul khrims kyi rgyus thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all thirty-two marks of the Great Man are obtained through the cause of morality, without distinction.

original: de mi'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de mi'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims nyams pa ni mir 'gyur ba nyid kyang mi 'thob na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims nyams pa ni mir 'gyur ba nyid kyang mi 'thob na /
translated: Because a bodhisattva who has violated morality does not even attain the state of a human being,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan lta ga la 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan lta ga la 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: much less the marks of a Great Man.

original: de la dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gcig yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa dang / spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gcig yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the possession of a crown protrusion and an invisible crown of the head should be understood as one mark of a Great Man,

original: de las gud na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gud na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not separate from that.

original: 'di ni mtshan mngon par 'grub pa dang / mthun pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs rgyas par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan mngon par 'grub pa dang / mthun pa'i las rnam pa sna tshogs rgyas par rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the various extensive types of karma that are conducive to the formation of the marks.

original: mdor bsdu na ni las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa phyogs gnyis su gyur pa rnam pa bzhis mtshan thams cad mngon par 'grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ni las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa phyogs gnyis su gyur pa rnam pa bzhis mtshan thams cad mngon par 'grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, it should be understood that all the major marks are achieved by four kinds of good works, which are twofold in their effects.

original: de la nges par 'byed pas ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pas ni zhabs shin tu gnas pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mark of having feet with prominent heels is achieved by the first kind of good works.

original: byang bar byed pas ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa dang / pags pa srab pa dang / sku'i bdun mtho ba dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang /🔽dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / sku tshe zhing drang @196a * //
analyzed: byang bar byed pas ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa dang / zhabs 'bar 'bur med pa dang / phyag dang zhabs dra bas 'brel pa dang / pags pa srab pa dang / sku'i bdun mtho ba dang / thal gong rgyas pa dang / dpung mgo legs par grub pa dang / sku tshe zhing drang @196a * //
translated: The marks of having feet with ankles that do not protrude, having hands and feet with a weblike membrane, having soft and youthful hands and feet, having seven elevated parts of the body, having a body that is well-proportioned, having shoulders that are well-rounded, having a bust that is well-developed,

original: ba dang ; ljags ring zhing srab pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: ba dang ; ljags ring zhing srab pa 'grub bo //
translated: having a body that is straight and well-filled out, and having a tongue that is long and slender are achieved by the second kind of good works.

original: rtag tu byed pas ni sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / sku ma btud pa dang / shing nya gro dha ltar chu zhing gab pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba 'grub po //
analyzed: rtag tu byed pas ni sor mo ring ba dang / zhabs kyi rting pa yangs pa dang / sku ma btud pa dang / shing nya gro dha ltar chu zhing gab pa dang / tshems thags bzang ba 'grub po //
translated: By always doing it, one achieves long fingers, broad heels, a body that is not bent over, and a sexual organ ensheathed like that of an elephant or a horse.

original: kha na ma tho ba med par byed pas ni mtshan lhag ma rnams mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par byed pas ni mtshan lhag ma rnams mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: By doing it without fault, one achieves the remaining marks.

original: de la sems can rnams la gnod pa med par sbyor bas ni phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / pags pa srab cing 'jam pa 'grub po //
analyzed: de la sems can rnams la gnod pa med par sbyor bas ni phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa dang / pags pa srab cing 'jam pa 'grub po //
translated: Therein, by applying oneself without harming sentient beings, one achieves hands and feet that are soft and youthful, and skin that is smooth and fine.

original: dge ba la go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang / dus su sbyor bas ni byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bur 'grub po //
analyzed: dge ba la go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang / dus su sbyor bas ni byin pa ri dags ae na ya'i lta bur 'grub po //
translated: By applying oneself to virtue in a timely way, one achieves calves like those of the eṇeya antelope.

original: mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / 'od gsal ba'i sems kyis dge ba kun du spyod pas ni sku mdog gser 'dra zhing 'od 'dom gang dang ldan pa dang / tshems dkar ba dang / mdzod spu dkar po 'grub po //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / 'od gsal ba'i sems kyis dge ba kun du spyod pas ni sku mdog gser 'dra zhing 'od 'dom gang dang ldan pa dang / tshems dkar ba dang / mdzod spu dkar po 'grub po //
translated: By practicing virtue with a mind of supreme joy, joy, and clear light, one attains a body the color of gold, a halo one fathom in width, white teeth, and a white tuft of hair between the eyebrows.

original: grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi rten pa dang ; dge ba mi spyoms pas ni mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa 'grub po //
analyzed: grags pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mi rten pa dang ; dge ba mi spyoms pas ni mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa 'grub po //
translated: By not relying on fame, reputation, or praise, and by not boasting about one's virtues, one attains the hidden organ of a great being, which is sheathed like that of a horse.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pas ni sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / tshems bzhi bcu dang mnyam pa dang / ro bro ba mkhyen pa dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa 'grub po //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pas ni sku'i spu gyen du phyogs pa dang / tshems bzhi bcu dang mnyam pa dang / ro bro ba mkhyen pa dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa 'grub po //
translated: By dedicating the roots of virtue to enlightenment, one attains body hairs that point upward, forty even teeth, the ability to taste the most sublime flavor, and a crown protrusion.

original: dge ba la 'bad cing mi zhum par brtson pas ni ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba 'grub po //
analyzed: dge ba la 'bad cing mi zhum par brtson pas ni ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba 'grub po //
translated: By striving at virtue without discouragement, one attains the torso and jaws of a lion.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa'i sems kyis snyoms par lta bas ni tshems mnyam pa dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu 'grub po //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa'i sems kyis snyoms par lta bas ni tshems mnyam pa dang / spyan mthon mthing dang / rdzi ma ba'i lta bu 'grub po //
translated: The even teeth and the deep blue eyes with eyelashes like a bull's are achieved by looking equally upon all beings with a mind of benefit.

original: dman pas chog par mi 'dzin par sbyor bas ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs 'grub po //
analyzed: dman pas chog par mi 'dzin par sbyor bas ni tshangs pa'i dbyangs 'grub po //
translated: The Brahma voice is achieved by not being satisfied with the inferior.

original: de ltar na las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa rnam pa 'di bzhis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag 'thob pa dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa rnam pa 'di bzhis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag 'thob pa dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by these four kinds of good works, the Bodhisattvas obtain and purify these thirty-two marks of a great person.

original: de la rigs kyi sa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan 'di dag sa bon tsam zhig gnas par zin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi sa la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan 'di dag sa bon tsam zhig gnas par zin par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the stage of the spiritual family, these marks of the Bodhisattvas should be understood as merely existing as seeds.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni de dag thob par bya ba'i thabs la zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni de dag thob par bya ba'i thabs la zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the stage of action out of faith, they should be understood as the means of attaining them.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la ni de dag thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la ni de dag thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the stage of pure universal responsibility, they should be understood as attained.

original: de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa de'i gong @196b ma rnams la ni de dag rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa de'i gong @196b ma rnams la ni de dag rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the bodhisattva stages that are below that stage, they should be understood as purified.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la ni de dag shin tu rnam par dag cing shin tu bla na med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la ni de dag shin tu rnam par dag cing shin tu bla na med par rig par bya'o //
translated: On the stage that goes to the culmination of the tathāgatas, they should be understood as extremely purified and extremely unsurpassed.

original: de la mtshan 'di rnams ni gzugs can yin pa'i phyir sems can tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab rnams kyis rtogs par sla bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yod pa thams cad kyi nang na 'di dag kho na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams su rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la mtshan 'di rnams ni gzugs can yin pa'i phyir sems can tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab rnams kyis rtogs par sla bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos skyes bu chen po'i mtshan yod pa thams cad kyi nang na 'di dag kho na skyes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams su rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Among all the marks of a great person that are the qualities of a buddha, these alone are established as the marks of a great person because these marks are easy to understand by inferior, middling, and superior sentient beings because they are physical.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag rten gyi tshul gyis 'dzin cing /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag rten gyi tshul gyis 'dzin cing /
translated: These thirty-two marks of a great person are established as marks because they are the basis for the major marks.

original: gzugs bzang pos mdzes par byed pas de'i phyir dpe byad bzang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang pos mdzes par byed pas de'i phyir dpe byad bzang po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called secondary signs because they are beautiful with good form.

original: de la mdor bsdu na sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams dang mnyam pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i khung bu re re mngon par 'grub po //🔽ba spu thams cad du zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de snyed kyi bsod nams kyi phung pos ni dpe byad bzang po gcig mngon par 'grub po //
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na sems can thams cad kyi bsod nams dang mnyam pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i khung bu re re mngon par 'grub po // ba spu thams cad du zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de snyed kyi bsod nams kyi phung pos ni dpe byad bzang po gcig mngon par 'grub po //
translated: In brief, the mass of merit equal to all the merits of all sentient beings establishes each pore of the body of the Tathagata.🔽The mass of merit that enters all the pores is the mass of merit that establishes one mark of a great being.🔽The mass of merit that enters all the marks is the mass of merit that establishes one minor mark of a great being.🔽The mass of merit that enters all the minor marks is the mass of merit that establishes one body of the Tathagata.

original: dpe byad bzang po thams cad du zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de las brgya 'gyur du bsgres pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan gcig mngon par 'grub po ;
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po thams cad du zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de las brgya 'gyur du bsgres pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan gcig mngon par 'grub po ;
translated: The mass of merit that enters all the bodies of the Tathagata is the mass of merit that establishes one word of the Tathagata.

original: ; mdzod spu dang gtsug tor ma gtogs par mtshan thams cad du zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de dag las stong 'gyur du bsgres pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni mdzod spu mngon par 'grub po //🔽mdzod spur zhugs pa bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de dag las 'bum 'gyur du bsgres pas ni dbu'i gtsug tor dang ldan zhing spyi gtsug bltar mi mngon par 'grub po //
analyzed: ; mdzod spu dang gtsug tor ma gtogs par mtshan thams cad du zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de dag las stong 'gyur du bsgres pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni mdzod spu mngon par 'grub po // mdzod spur zhugs pa bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de dag las 'bum 'gyur du bsgres pas ni dbu'i gtsug tor dang ldan zhing spyi gtsug bltar mi mngon par 'grub po //
translated: The mass of merit that enters all the marks, except for the ūrṇā and the uṣṇīṣa, when multiplied by a thousand, is the mass of merit that establishes the ūrṇā.🔽The mass of merit that enters the ūrṇā, when multiplied by a hundred thousand, is the mass of merit that establishes the uṣṇīṣa and the invisible crown of the head.

original: mdzod spur zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de dag las bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur du bsgres pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi dung zhes bya ba gzhan mngon🔽par 'grub ste /
analyzed: mdzod spur zhugs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de dag las bye ba phrag 'bum 'gyur du bsgres pa'i bsod nams kyi phung pos ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi dung zhes bya ba gzhan mngon🔽par 'grub ste /
translated: The mass of merit that enters the ūrṇā, when multiplied by a hundred thousand times ten to the fiftieth power, is the mass of merit that establishes the other mark of the Tathāgata called the Dharma conch shell, which is not included in the marks and the excellent signs.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag tu gsung gis go bar mdzad de /
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag tu gsung gis go bar mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, if the Tathagata wishes, he can make his voice understood in limitless, endless world systems.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab cing bla na med pa phun sum tshogs pa @197a * //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab cing bla na med pa phun sum tshogs pa @197a * //
translated: Thus, the inconceivable, unsurpassed, perfect body of the Tathagata is accomplished,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis yongs su bsdus pa bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pas yang dag par grub pa 'grub po //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis yongs su bsdus pa bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pas yang dag par grub pa 'grub po //
translated: which is included in all aspects, perfectly accomplished by immeasurable collections of merit.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'grub par byed pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag ni mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis dpag tu med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'grub par byed pa'i dge ba'i chos de dag ni mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis dpag tu med par rig par bya ste /
translated: Those virtuous qualities that accomplish the major and minor marks should be known in brief as immeasurable due to three causes.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms par byas pas 'grub pas na /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms par byas pas 'grub pas na /
translated: They are accomplished by being cultivated for three incalculable eons.

original: dus dpag tu med pa dang / sems can dpag tu med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pas dbang byed pas na /
analyzed: dus dpag tu med pa dang / sems can dpag tu med pa la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pas dbang byed pas na /
translated: They are controlled by the intention to benefit and bring happiness to immeasurable sentient beings.

original: bsam pa dpag tu med pa dang / dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dang / rnam pa dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dpag tu med pa dang / dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dang / rnam pa dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: the immeasurable thought, the immeasurable various kinds of wholesome actions, and the immeasurable aspects.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'byor pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa las yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'byor pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa las yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of the major and minor characteristics of the Tathagatas is said to be accomplished from the immeasurable accumulation of merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i le'u ste lnga pa'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i le'u ste lnga pa'o / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa gcig pa /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the major and minor characteristics, the fifth chapter of the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of complete purity?

original: gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / sems yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Complete purity of basis, complete purity of object, complete purity of mind, and complete purity of wisdom.

original: de la gnas yongs su dag pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la gnas yongs su dag pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is complete purity of basis?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len bag chags dang bcas pa rnams gnas las ma lus par gtan med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len bag chags dang bcas pa rnams gnas las ma lus par gtan med par 'gyur la /
translated: All the negative tendencies that are in accord with the side of all the afflictions, together with their traces, are completely and totally eliminated.

original: rang gi lus kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du len pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba rang la dbang yod pa ni gnas rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du len pa dang / gnas pa dang / 'chi 'pho ba rang la dbang yod pa ni gnas rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And one has power over one’s own body, taking it up, maintaining it, and passing away as one wishes. This is called “the purity of the bases in all respects.”

original: de la dmigs pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purity of the object?

original: sprul pa dang / bsgyur pa dang / bstan pa dmigs pa thams cad la dbang yod pa gang yin pa 'di ni dmigs pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa dang / bsgyur pa dang / bstan pa dmigs pa thams cad la dbang yod pa gang yin pa 'di ni dmigs pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having power over all objects, such as emanations, transformations, and displays, this is called “the purity of the object in all respects.”

original: de la sems yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purity of the mind?

original: snga ma bzhin du sems gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral la /
translated: As before, the mind is free from all negative tendencies.

original: sems la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pas na /
analyzed: sems la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pas na /
translated: And because the mind has accumulated all the roots of virtue,

original: sems rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “the purity of the mind in all respects.”

original: de la ye shes yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ye shes yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purity of pristine wisdom?

original: snga ma bzhin du ma rig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad @197b dang bral la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ma rig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad @197b dang bral la /
translated: It is the absence of all the negative tendencies that are in accord with the class of ignorance, as previously described.

original: shes bya thams cad la yang ye shes kyi sgrib pa med de /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la yang ye shes kyi sgrib pa med de /
translated: It is also the absence of the obscurations to pristine wisdom with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: ye shes la dbang byed pa ni ye shes rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang byed pa ni ye shes rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mastery of pristine wisdom is called the purity of all aspects of pristine wisdom.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten powers of the Tathagata?

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po'i mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po'i mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: They are the power of knowledge of what is possible and what is not possible; the power of knowledge of the results of actions; the power of knowledge of various higher and lower faculties; the power of knowledge of the various elements of the world; the power of knowledge of the various aspirations of beings; the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere; the power of knowledge of the recollection of former existences; the power of knowledge of death and rebirth; the power of knowledge of the extinction of the outflows; and the power of knowledge of the most excellent truth of the Dharma.

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing the various inclinations of beings, the power of knowing the various dhātus, the power of knowing the superior and inferior faculties of beings, the power of knowing the path that leads everywhere, the power of knowing the recollection of former existences, the power of knowing death and rebirth,

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
translated: and the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: stobs bcu po 'di dag ni stobs bcu'i mdo las rgyas par ci skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: stobs bcu po 'di dag ni stobs bcu'i mdo las rgyas par ci skad bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o ;
translated: These ten powers should be understood in detail according to what is taught in the Sūtra on the Ten Powers.

original: ; de la des gang ci bstan pa dang / brjod pa dang / gsungs pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: ; de la des gang ci bstan pa dang / brjod pa dang / gsungs pa de dag thams cad ni de bzhin te /
translated: Whatever is taught, expressed, or spoken by him is all just so.

original: phyin ci ma log pas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pas na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is non-erroneous, he is called the Tathāgata.

original: de la 'bras bu dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu byung bar gyur pa mi mthun pa med pa gang yin pa de ni de'i gnas dang gzhi dang / rten dang mngon par 'grub par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rgyu byung bar gyur pa mi mthun pa med pa gang yin pa de ni de'i gnas dang gzhi dang / rten dang mngon par 'grub par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of the wholesome and unwholesome results that arise is called their basis, foundation, support, and producer.

original: de las bzlog pa rgyu mi mthun pa ni 'bras bu dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid kyi gnas ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rgyu mi mthun pa ni 'bras bu dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid kyi gnas ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the cause that is not the basis of the wholesome and unwholesome results.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ste /
translated: The knowledge that is free from false pride is called “as it really is.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang / dag pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i ye shes yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang / dag pa de ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i ye shes yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That is the knowledge of the omniscient one, the knowledge free from attachment, and the pure knowledge. It should be understood as the knowledge free from false pride.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: These words “omniscient” and so on are to be understood as explained previously,

original: byang chub mchog gi le'u las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub mchog gi le'u las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: as in the chapter on supreme enlightenment.

original: dang po ni go rims kyis bgrang ba'i dang po'o //
analyzed: dang po ni go rims kyis bgrang ba'i dang po'o //
translated: The first is the first in numerical order.

original: bla na med pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad byed nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / bdud thams cad kyi stobs gtan du zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad byed nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / bdud thams cad kyi stobs gtan du zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called strength because it is unsurpassed, because it is endowed with the ability to perform all the functions of benefiting all sentient beings, and because it completely overwhelms the power of all demons.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir /🔽ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du yang dag par spyod @198a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir / ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du yang dag par spyod @198a * //
translated: It is called endowment because it is the cause for the attainment of the way things really are.

original: pa la dbang byed pa ni ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa la dbang byed pa ni ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called possession because it is mastery over the correct practice in accordance with one’s wishes.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa yin pas na rlabs po che zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bla na med pa yin pas na rlabs po che zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called greatness because nirvana is unsurpassed.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'thob pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa dang 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir khyu mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'thob pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa dang 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir khyu mchog ces bya'o //
translated: It is called bull because it obtains the eightfold noble path and is free from all harm and fear.

original: bdag nyid kyis de rtogs par zhal gyis 'che bas dam bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis de rtogs par zhal gyis 'che bas dam bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called vow because one promises to realize it by oneself.

original: bdag nyid kyi thugs su chud nas gzhan dag la yang thugs brtse bas rgyas par bstan pas na tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi thugs su chud nas gzhan dag la yang thugs brtse bas rgyas par bstan pas na tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor zhes bya'o //
translated: Having understood it himself, he then compassionately taught it extensively to others. Therefore, it is called the “Brahmic wheel.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste tshangs pa zhes bya ba dang / zhi ba zhes bya ba dang / bsil bar gyur pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshangs pa zhes bya ba dang / zhi ba zhes bya ba dang / bsil bar gyur pa zhes bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig bla dags yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because “Brahma,” “peace,” and “coolness” are epithets of the Tathāgata.

original: de bas na de ni thog mar des bskor ro //
analyzed: de bas na de ni thog mar des bskor ro //
translated: Therefore, he first turned the wheel for him.

original: tshangs pas bskyod nas de ma yin pa gzhan dag gis kyang de las gzhan pa dag la ste /
analyzed: tshangs pas bskyod nas de ma yin pa gzhan dag gis kyang de las gzhan pa dag la ste /
translated: After Brahma set it in motion, others also set it in motion for others.

original: 'di ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de /
translated: In this way, it was passed on from one to another.

original: sems can gyi ris thams cad du 'khor bas de'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris thams cad du 'khor bas de'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it circulated among all the classes of sentient beings, it is called the “Brahmic wheel.”

original: mchog tu gdags par gtogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bla na med pas bsdus par bdag nyid rnam par bsgrags pa'i phyir dang / de'i lam bstan pas kyang de ma yin pa'i ya mtshan can thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang / lam de dang mi mthun par smra ba 'ongs pa rnams la bag 'khums pa med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: mchog tu gdags par gtogs pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bla na med pas bsdus par bdag nyid rnam par bsgrags pa'i phyir dang / de'i lam bstan pas kyang de ma yin pa'i ya mtshan can thams cad spangs pa'i phyir dang / lam de dang mi mthun par smra ba 'ongs pa rnams la bag 'khums pa med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: He proclaims himself to be the one who is included in the highest of the highest, who is endowed with the highest of the highest teachings, who has abandoned all other wonder-workers by teaching his path, and who is not intimidated by the arrival of opponents who speak against that path.

original: phas kyi rgol ba rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir rgya che zhing bla na med pa'i gsung mngon par brjod pa'i phyir 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ces bya'o //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba rnams zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir rgya che zhing bla na med pa'i gsung mngon par brjod pa'i phyir 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ces bya'o //
translated: He is said to roar the lion’s roar in the assembly because he proclaims his teaching, which is vast and unsurpassed, in order to overpower his adversaries.

original: mdor bsdu na ni bdag la phan pa'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa de dag gsal bar byas shing bkrol te brtags shing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ni bdag la phan pa'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa de dag gsal bar byas shing bkrol te brtags shing bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, he has revealed, explained, analyzed, and taught the uncommon perfections of accomplishing benefit for himself and the perfections of accomplishing benefit for both himself and others.

original: don gyi mdo'i rnam grangs gzhan yang thob par bya ba dang / de thob par bya ba'i thabs dang / thabs de yang skye bo thams cad la phan pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyi mdo'i rnam grangs gzhan yang thob par bya ba dang / de thob par bya ba'i thabs dang / thabs de yang skye bo thams cad la phan pa yin te /
translated: Another enumeration of the meaning of the verses is: the goal to be attained, the means to attain it, and the benefit of that means for all beings.

original: lhar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: lhar gyur pa'am /
translated: Whether one is a god or a human,

original: mir gyur pa gang su yang rung ba thabs des 'dod pa de dag thams cad kyis ni nga nyid las thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mir gyur pa gang su yang rung ba thabs des 'dod pa de dag thams cad kyis ni nga nyid las thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: whatever one desires is attained from me alone.

analyzed: de la khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas ni nad rab tu zhi ba dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The state of the great bull should be seen as like the complete pacification of the disease.

analyzed: tshangs pa'i @198b 'khor lo bskor ba ni nad rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i thabs lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: The turning of the wheel of Brahmā should be seen as like the means for the complete pacification of the disease.

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrags pa ni sman pa ngan pa thams cad kyis dam bcas pa spangs pa lta bu dang / bdag nyid kyis nges par nad rab tu zhi bar dam bcas pa lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par bsgrags pa ni sman pa ngan pa thams cad kyis dam bcas pa spangs pa lta bu dang / bdag nyid kyis nges par nad rab tu zhi bar dam bcas pa lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: The proclamation of the lion’s roar in the assembly should be seen as like the abandonment of the assertions of all bad doctors and like one’s own assertion of the complete pacification of the disease.

original: las gang dag byas shing bsags la 'gags pa de dag ni 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las gang dag byas shing bsags la 'gags pa de dag ni 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The actions that have been done and accumulated and have ceased are called “past”.

original: gang dag byas pa yang ma yin 'gag pa yang ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang dag byas pa yang ma yin 'gag pa yang ma yin pa /

original: byed pa yang ma yin mod kyi /

analyzed: phyis byed par 'gyur pa de dag ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //

original: las gang dag byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: las gang dag byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: Those actions that have not been done

original: 'gag pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: and have not ceased

translated: but are being done and are being sought after are called “present”.🔽They are also classified as threefold: bodily action, vocal action, and mental action.

original: de dag kyang rnam pa'i dbye ba'i sgo nas ni lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las gsum dang / chos yang dag par blangs shing sngar ji ltar bstan pa ste /

original: chos yang dag par blang pa da ltar bde la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang yod ces bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos yang dag par blang pa da ltar bde la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba yang yod ces bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: There is wholesome action that is pleasant now and ripens in the future as suffering.

analyzed: de dag kyang tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la phan pa dang / gnod pa'i sbyor ba las ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are to be understood as being respectively beneficial or harmful in this life and in future lives.

analyzed: yul gang du byed pa de ni de dag gi gnas zhes bya'o // sems can du bgrang ba'am ;
translated: The place where they are performed is called their domain.

analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gang la brten nas byed pa de ni de dag gi dngos po zhes bya'o // mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'am /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang rung zhig gang gis byed pa de ni de dag gi rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause by which they are performed is either a root of nonvirtue or a root of virtue.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'bras bu 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //

translated: The result that is produced by them is either a pleasant or unpleasant result, or a result that is a source of misfortune or an advantage.

original: de bas na de dag bsdus nas dus thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / gnas skabs thams cad du sbyor ba dang / yul thams cad dang / gnas thams cad dang / gzhi thams cad dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi las mkhyen pa'i rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa yin te /

translated: Therefore, the tathāgatas’ knowledge of actions is always, in all its aspects, connected with all times, all aspects, and all situations; with all objects, all places, all bases, all faults, and all benefits.

original: de las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: de las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: sems la dbang thob pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i don rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir de dang mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dang de la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: “The Bhagavat entered such a samadhi that

analyzed: ji ltar thugs mnyam par gzhag pas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten thams cad snang ba chen pos khyab par gyur to //

analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i don gang dang gang kho na sgrub par bzhed pa na /
translated: Thus, the Tathagata, when he wishes to accomplish any matter, whether common or uncommon,

analyzed: de dang de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs nas myur ba myur ba kho nar 'grub par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bya ba ni de kho nar zad de /
translated: The only activity of the dhyana practitioners is this.

analyzed: de las gong na yang med do //

analyzed: de las lhag pa yang med do //
