original: de ltar na gang gis skye ba dang / skyes nas kyang gang nyams su myong ba dang / de nyams su myong nas kyang bdag gis byas pa'i sdug bsngal de ma yin pa gzhan yang mngon par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis skye ba dang / skyes nas kyang gang nyams su myong ba dang / de nyams su myong nas kyang bdag gis byas pa'i sdug bsngal de ma yin pa gzhan yang mngon par 'grub pa ste /
translated: Thus, by whom is there birth? And having been born, what is experienced? And having experienced that, what is produced other than that suffering which is self-made?

original: 'di dag ni ming de dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ming de dag gis bstan to //
translated: These are taught by those names.

original: dge ba'i phyogs thams cad ni de las bzlog pa ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs thams cad ni de las bzlog pa ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The virtuous side should be understood as the opposite of that in every way, as is appropriate.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there is this difference:

original: legs par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'gro ba ni bde 'gro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'gro ba ni bde 'gro zhes bya'o //
translated: The destiny that is preceded by good conduct is called a good destiny.

original: bde ba la longs spyod pa mchog yin pa'i phyir mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba la longs spyod pa mchog yin pa'i phyir mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the enjoyment of pleasure is supreme, it is called the world of the gods.

original: zag pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: zag pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ;
translated: Because all the latent tendencies of all the contaminants are completely abandoned,

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa zag pa med pa'i sems dang / zag pa med pa'i shes rab lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab mchog gis bsdus pa ni zag pa rnams zad pas /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa zag pa med pa'i sems dang / zag pa med pa'i shes rab lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab mchog gis bsdus pa ni zag pa rnams zad pas /
translated: The antidote to that is the pure mind and the pure wisdom that is the antidote to the contaminants, which are included in the supreme mind and the supreme wisdom.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the destruction of the contaminants, it is called the liberation of the mind and the liberation of wisdom that are pure.

original: sems rnam @201b par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba de yang srid pa tha ma de nyid la mthong ba'i lam la yang brten /
analyzed: sems rnam @201b par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba de yang srid pa tha ma de nyid la mthong ba'i lam la yang brten /
translated: That liberation of the mind and that liberation of wisdom are attained in dependence on the path of seeing and in dependence on the path of cultivation in that very last existence.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la yang brten te thob nas srid pa tha ma nyid de la bdag gis thob po snyam du mngon par shes pa drug pas /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la yang brten te thob nas srid pa tha ma nyid de la bdag gis thob po snyam du mngon par shes pa drug pas /
translated: Having attained them in that very last existence, one knows by means of the sixth superknowledge that one has attained them.

original: rang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: rang gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: One knows them just as they are, in reality, by oneself.

original: 'dod na gzhan dag la yang ston te /
analyzed: 'dod na gzhan dag la yang ston te /
translated: If one wishes, one can also teach them to others.

original: de lta bas na tshe 'di nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas rjod par byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshe 'di nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas rjod par byed ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one teaches them having attained them by means of one’s own superknowledge in this very life.

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi dbye ba ni rnam grangs bsdu ba las rig par bya'o /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi dbye ba ni rnam grangs bsdu ba las rig par bya'o /
translated: The classifications of the words “I have exhausted my births” and so on should be understood from the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary:🔽Nature, divisions,🔽unmixed qualities,

original: rang bzhin dang ni rab dbye dang // ma 'dres pa dang mnyam pa nyid //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni rab dbye dang // ma 'dres pa dang mnyam pa nyid //
translated: sameness,🔽functions, order,

original: las byed pa dang go rims dang // tha ma pa ni bye brag yin //
analyzed: las byed pa dang go rims dang // tha ma pa ni bye brag yin //
translated: and the last is distinction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag gi rang bzhin yang rig par bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag gi rang bzhin yang rig par bya /
translated: The nature of these ten powers of the tathāgatas should be understood,

original: rab tu dbye ba yang rig par bya /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba yang rig par bya /
translated: their divisions should be understood,

original: ma 'dres pa yang rig par bya /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yang rig par bya /
translated: their unmixed qualities should be understood,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyang rig par bya /🔽las byed pa yang rig par bya /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyang rig par bya / las byed pa yang rig par bya /
translated: their sameness should be understood,🔽their functions should be understood,

original: go rims kyang rig par bya /
analyzed: go rims kyang rig par bya /
translated: their order should be understood,

original: bye brag kyang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag kyang rig par bya ste /
translated: and their distinctions should be understood.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bdun po 'di dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa bdun po 'di dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, these ten powers of the tathāgatas should be understood through these seven aspects.

original: de la de dag gi rang bzhin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de dag gi rang bzhin gang zhe na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ni dbang po lnga yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ni dbang po lnga yin te /
translated: Their nature is the five faculties.

original: 'on kyang shes rab gtso bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ste /🔽'di ltar gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba'i dad pa'i stobs she'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes rab gtso bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ste / 'di ltar gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba'i dad pa'i stobs she'am /
translated: However, since wisdom is the principal element, it is called the nature of wisdom.

original: de ma yin pa'i stobs zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i stobs zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is not called the power of faith, or the power of something other than wisdom, that is to say, the power of the knowledge of proper and improper conditions.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ci lta ba bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ci lta ba bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining powers should be understood in the same way as the power of the knowledge of proper and improper conditions.

original: de la de dag gi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de dag gi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is their classification?

original: mdor bsdu na rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gsum gyis de dag tshad med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rab tu dbye ba rnam pa gsum gyis de dag tshad med par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, their classification should be understood as immeasurable, but it can be summarized as threefold:🔽by way of object, by way of time period, and by way of the three knowledges.

original: dus kyi rab tu dbye bas ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa'i shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus kyi rab tu dbye bas ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa'i shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By way of object, the knowledge of the buddhas is infinite, because it engages all objects of knowledge, which are classified as the five kinds of knowledge.

original: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po re re'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems kyi rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyud thams cad kyi re re'i don @202a * //
analyzed: rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po re re'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro // sems kyi rgyud kyi rab tu dbye bas ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyud thams cad kyi re re'i don @202a * //
translated: By the differentiation of aspects, he penetrates the knowledge of all aspects through the specific characteristics and the general characteristics of each conditioned thing.

original: thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the differentiation of the mental continuum, he penetrates the meaning of each of all the mental continuities in all the universes of the ten directions.

original: de ltar na rab tu dbye ba gsum po 'di dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag dpag tu med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rab tu dbye ba gsum po 'di dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag dpag tu med par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, by these three differentiations, these ten powers of the Tathāgata should be known as immeasurable.

original: 'di ni de rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: This is their differentiation.

original: de la de rnams kyi ma 'dres pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de rnams kyi ma 'dres pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is their uniqueness?

original: stobs bcu po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: stobs bcu po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa kho na'i yin te /
translated: These ten powers belong only to the Tathāgata,

original: 'ba' zhig pa ma 'dres pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa ma 'dres pa yin gyi /
translated: they are unique,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: not shared by any of the disciples or individual Buddhas.

original: 'di ni de dag gi ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi ma 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called their “unsharedness.”

original: stobs bcu 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshungs shing khyad par med de /
analyzed: stobs bcu 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshungs shing khyad par med de /
translated: These ten powers are the same for all Tathagatas and have no distinctions.

original: 'di ni de dag gi mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: This is their “sameness.”

original: gnas pa'i bye brag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzhan dang gzhan du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i bye brag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams gzhan dang gzhan du yang 'gyur te /
translated: The Tathagatas are distinguished by the differences in their stations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan stobs gzhan gyi gnas pas shas cher gnas la gzhan ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan stobs gzhan gyi gnas pas shas cher gnas la gzhan ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: One Tathagata is distinguished by the station of one power, another by another.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas stobs bcu po de dag las gang gis las gang mdzad ce na /🔽gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu la yang rgyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas stobs bcu po de dag las gang gis las gang mdzad ce na / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas rgyu la yang rgyur /
translated: By which of these ten powers does the Tathagata perform his activities?

original: 'bras bu la yang 'bras bur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yang 'bras bur yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: By means of the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper, the Tathagata knows causes as causes and effects as effects.

original: rgyu med pa dang / 'bras bu med pa rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang / 'bras bu med pa rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
translated: He also refutes the ascetics and brahmins who propound the nonexistence of causes and effects and the nonexistence of actions.

original: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu la spyod pa'i las rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas bdag gis byas pa'i 'bras bu la spyod pa'i las rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: By means of the power of knowledge of the ripening of actions, the Tathagata knows perfectly well the actions that are to be experienced as the results of what has been done by each person.

original: sbyin pa dang / bsod nams 'pho bar smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / bsod nams 'pho bar smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
translated: He also refutes the ascetics and brahmins who propound the transference of the results of giving and merit.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba rnams la cho 'phrul gsum gyis legs par 'doms te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas 'dul ba rnams la cho 'phrul gsum gyis legs par 'doms te /
translated: By means of the power of knowledge of the absorptions, the liberations, and entering states of one-pointed concentration, the Tathagata instructs those to be tamed by means of the three types of miraculous displays.

original: so sor 'gal ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi mthun par smra ba la gnas pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
analyzed: so sor 'gal ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi mthun par smra ba la gnas pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
translated: He also defeats the ascetics and brahmins who are his opponents, who are in opposition to him, who are not in accord with him.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams kyi dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas sems can rnams kyi dbang po chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang rnam par phye nas /
translated: By means of the power of knowledge of the degree of the higher and lower faculties, the Tathagata, having distinguished the lesser, middling and greater faculties of sentient beings,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba @202b bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba @202b bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: knows them in accordance with reality.

original: de dag la yang ci rigs pa dang / ci 'os par chos ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de dag la yang ci rigs pa dang / ci 'os par chos ston par mdzad de /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to them in a manner that is appropriate and suitable.

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba dang mi dge ba la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas dge ba dang mi dge ba la mos pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: By means of the power of knowledge of the various resolves, the Tathagata knows in accordance with reality the lesser, middling and greater resolves of sentient beings that are virtuous or non-virtuous.

original: dge ba'i mos pa ni 'phel bar mdzad do //
analyzed: dge ba'i mos pa ni 'phel bar mdzad do //
translated: He causes the virtuous resolve to increase.

original: mi dge ba'i mos pa ni 'dor du 'jug go //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i mos pa ni 'dor du 'jug go //
translated: He causes the non-virtuous resolve to be abandoned.

original: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas khams ngan pa dang 'bring dang / bzang po rnam par phye nas yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas khams ngan pa dang 'bring dang / bzang po rnam par phye nas yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: By the power of knowing the various elements, the Tathagata, having distinguished the inferior, middling, and superior elements, knows them perfectly as they are.

original: dbang po ji lta ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba dang / bag la nyal ci lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams 'jug pa'i sgo de dang de dag tu gdags pa'i bya bas yang dag par ci rigs par legs par 'dzud par mdzad do //
analyzed: dbang po ji lta ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba dang / bag la nyal ci lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams 'jug pa'i sgo de dang de dag tu gdags pa'i bya bas yang dag par ci rigs par legs par 'dzud par mdzad do //
translated: He perfectly and appropriately introduces sentient beings to the various entryways, such as the faculties, the inclinations, and the latent propensities, by means of the actions of designation.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ci ltar nyan thos rnams la 'jug pa'i sgo de dang de dag tu gdams ngag sbyin par mdzad pa de lta bu ni nyan thos kyi sa las thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyun chags su bstan cing gsal bar byas
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ci ltar nyan thos rnams la 'jug pa'i sgo de dang de dag tu gdams ngag sbyin par mdzad pa de lta bu ni nyan thos kyi sa las thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyun chags su bstan cing gsal bar byas
translated: The Tathagatas give instructions to the disciples in the various entryways in such a way that all of it is taught, revealed, clarified,

original: te / bkrol zhing brtags nas bshad zin to //
analyzed: te / bkrol zhing brtags nas bshad zin to //
translated: unraveled, examined, and explained in the Sravaka Levels.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa las thog ma pa ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa la gnas par gyur pa sems gnas par 'dod pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ci ltar gdams ngag ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa las thog ma pa ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa la gnas par gyur pa sems gnas par 'dod pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir / ci ltar gdams ngag ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: How do the tathāgatas instruct the bodhisattvas who are beginners, who are at the very beginning of the accumulation of meditative stabilization, who are abiding in the accumulation of meditative stabilization, who wish to stabilize their minds?

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' g-yo ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs lhur len pa dang las dang po pa las thog ma pa de la thog ma kho nar 'di ltar gdams ngag ston par mdzad do /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa' g-yo ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs lhur len pa dang las dang po pa las thog ma pa de la thog ma kho nar 'di ltar gdams ngag ston par mdzad do /
translated: In this regard, the tathāgatas first instruct the bodhisattvas who are beginners, who are at the very beginning of the accumulation of meditative stabilization, who are intent on the accumulation of meditative stabilization that is free of movement, in the following way:🔽“Come here, son of noble family!

original: rigs kyi bu tshur shog / rab tu dben pa'i gnas mal du gcig pu gnyis su med par 'dug la /🔽khyod kyi pha ma gnyis sam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tshur shog / rab tu dben pa'i gnas mal du gcig pu gnyis su med par 'dug la / khyod kyi pha ma gnyis sam /
translated: Sit alone in a secluded place, without a companion.🔽Think about the name that was given to you by your father and mother,

original: mkhan po dang / slob dpon gnyis kyis ming btags pa gang yin pa'i ming de nyid nad du yid la byas la /
analyzed: mkhan po dang / slob dpon gnyis kyis ming btags pa gang yin pa'i ming de nyid nad du yid la byas la /
translated: or by your preceptor and teacher.

original: 'di snyam du yang ci bdag gi skye mched la ma gtogs pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub pa 'ba' zhig nang ngam phyi rol na yod dam /
analyzed: 'di snyam du yang ci bdag gi skye mched la ma gtogs pa'i chos rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub pa 'ba' zhig nang ngam phyi rol na yod dam /
translated: Think in this way: “Is there a phenomenon that is not included in my sense spheres, that exists by its very nature, either internally or externally?

original: gnyis ka med pa la yang yod dam /
analyzed: gnyis ka med pa la yang yod dam /
translated: Is it nonexistent in both ways?

original: gang la ming dang 'du shes dang gdags pa dang nye bar gdags pa 'jug pa yod dam snyam du yid la @203a * //
analyzed: gang la ming dang 'du shes dang gdags pa dang nye bar gdags pa 'jug pa yod dam snyam du yid la @203a * //
translated: Is there a name, a concept, a designation, or a designation as a mere conventional term that applies to it?”

original: byos shig dang / khyod de ltar yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: byos shig dang / khyod de ltar yid la byed pa na /
translated: When you think in this way,

original: khyod kyi chos de mi dmigs kyi khyod 'di kho na snyam du glo bur gyi chos rnams kho na la glo bur gyi ming 'byung ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyod kyi chos de mi dmigs kyi khyod 'di kho na snyam du glo bur gyi chos rnams kho na la glo bur gyi ming 'byung ngo snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: you will not observe that phenomenon. You will think, “It is only my mind that thinks that there is a phenomenon that is not included in my sense spheres, that exists by its very nature, either internally or externally, that is nonexistent in both ways, or that is a name, a concept, a designation, or a designation as a mere conventional term that applies to it.”

original: rigs kyi bu khyod gang gi tshe rang gi ming de las glo bur ba yin par 'du shes skyes shing thob par gyur pa dang / khyod kyis khyod kyi mig la mig ces bya ba dang / mig tu 'du shes pa dang / mig tu 'dogs pa gang yin pa de yang nang du tshul bzhin du yid la byos la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod gang gi tshe rang gi ming de las glo bur ba yin par 'du shes skyes shing thob par gyur pa dang / khyod kyis khyod kyi mig la mig ces bya ba dang / mig tu 'du shes pa dang / mig tu 'dogs pa gang yin pa de yang nang du tshul bzhin du yid la byos la /
translated: and you properly attend to your eyes, thinking, ‘What is called “eye,” the notion of eye, and the designation of eye, that is just the mere thing that exists because of this name, this notion, and this designation.

original: 'di snyam du yang mig 'di la gnyis dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du yang mig 'di la gnyis dmigs te /
translated: This is the observation of duality in the eye.

original: mig ces bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes dang gdags pa 'di dang ; gang la ming dang 'du shes dang gdags pa 'di yod pa'i dngos po tsam 'di yod par zad de /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes dang gdags pa 'di dang ; gang la ming dang 'du shes dang gdags pa 'di yod pa'i dngos po tsam 'di yod par zad de /
translated: There is just this much that exists: this name, this notion, and this designation called “eye,” and the mere thing that exists because of this name, this notion, and this designation.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med de /
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: de la mig gi ming dang / 'du shes dang / gdags pa gang yin pa de yang mig ma yin la /
analyzed: de la mig gi ming dang / 'du shes dang / gdags pa gang yin pa de yang mig ma yin la /
translated: What is called the name, the notion, and the designation of the eye is not the eye.

original: gang la mig gi 'du shes 'byung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang rang bzhin gyis mig ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la mig gi 'du shes 'byung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang rang bzhin gyis mig ma yin no //
translated: The thing in regard to which the idea of eye occurs is also not naturally the eye.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la mig gi ming dang / mig gi 'du shes dang / mig gi gdags pa med par ni su yang mig gi blo 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mig gi ming dang / mig gi 'du shes dang / mig gi gdags pa med par ni su yang mig gi blo 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, without the name “eye,” the idea of eye, and the designation of eye, no one would have the idea of eye.

original: gal te dngos po de ming gang gis brjod pa de'i bdag nyid kho nas yongs su grub pa zhig yin na ni der yang de la ltos nas gzod mig ces bya ba'i blo de lta bu mi 'jug gi / ming ma thos pa dang / yongs su ma brtags pa'i rang bzhin kho na 'ba' zhig gis dngos po de la mig ces bya ba'i blo 'jug pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po de ming gang gis brjod pa de'i bdag nyid kho nas yongs su grub pa zhig yin na ni der yang de la ltos nas gzod mig ces bya ba'i blo de lta bu mi 'jug gi / ming ma thos pa dang / yongs su ma brtags pa'i rang bzhin kho na 'ba' zhig gis dngos po de la mig ces bya ba'i blo 'jug pa'i rigs na /
translated: If that thing were fully established just by the name by which it is expressed, then the idea of eye would not occur in that way in dependence on that, but it would be reasonable for the idea of eye to occur in regard to that thing just by its own nature, without hearing the name and without examination.

original: 'jug pa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: But it is not observed to occur in that way.

original: de lta bas na mig gi ming dang mig gi 'du shes 'di yang glo bur ba'i chos la glo bur du byung ba yin par yid la gyis shig / de ltar khyod nang gi mig 'di la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: de lta bas na mig gi ming dang mig gi 'du shes 'di yang glo bur ba'i chos la glo bur du byung ba yin par yid la gyis shig / de ltar khyod nang gi mig 'di la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa na /
translated: When you properly attend to this inner eye,

original: mig gi 'du shes la yang glo bur gyi 'du shes skye zhing 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi 'du shes la yang glo bur gyi 'du shes skye zhing 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: you will generate and attain the notion of adventitiousness with respect to the notion of eye.

original: mig la ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang ; lus rnams nas rgyas par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / thob pa rnams dang / btsal ba rnams dang /
analyzed: mig la ji lta ba bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang ; lus rnams nas rgyas par mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams dang / thob pa rnams dang / btsal ba rnams dang /
translated: Just as with the eye, you should understand the ear, nose, tongue, and body in detail, as well as what is seen, heard, distinguished, and realized, what is obtained and sought,

original: yid kyis rjes su brtags pa rnams dang / rjes su dpyad pa rnams kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yid kyis rjes su brtags pa rnams dang / rjes su dpyad pa rnams kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: and what is investigated and analyzed by the mind.

original: mdor bsdu na chos rnams kyi 'du shes @203b rnams la glo bur gyi 'du shes skye zhing thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na chos rnams kyi 'du shes @203b rnams la glo bur gyi 'du shes skye zhing thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In brief, you will generate and attain the notion of adventitiousness with respect to the notions of phenomena.

original: de ltar gyur na khyod rang gi de dag la 'du shes gang yin pa de dang bral bar bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam yang dag par yongs su bzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na khyod rang gi de dag la 'du shes gang yin pa de dang bral bar bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam yang dag par yongs su bzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you do so, you will take up the path of practice that is free from the perception of those things.

original: rgyas par chos thams cad kyi bar gyi 'du shes gang yin pa de dang bral bar bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas par chos thams cad kyi bar gyi 'du shes gang yin pa de dang bral bar bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, you will take up the path of practice that is free from the perception of all phenomena, up to and including all phenomena.

original: de ltar khyod kyis shes bya thams cad shin tu dpyad pa'i blos chos thams cad kyi 'du shes rnams la glo bur du 'du shes nas /
analyzed: de ltar khyod kyis shes bya thams cad shin tu dpyad pa'i blos chos thams cad kyi 'du shes rnams la glo bur du 'du shes nas /
translated: In this way, with a mind that has thoroughly analyzed all objects of knowledge, you will perceive the perceptions of all phenomena as adventitious.

original: chos thams cad la spros pa thams cad kyi 'du shes sol la /
analyzed: chos thams cad la spros pa thams cad kyi 'du shes sol la /
translated: You will remove the perception of all conceptual elaborations with regard to all phenomena.🔽You will frequently abide in the nonconceptual mind, which is free from signs and engages in apprehending mere objects.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems mtshan ma med pa don tsam 'dzin pa la zhugs pas dngos po de la lan mang du gnas par gyis shig / de ltar byas pa dang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rigs pas
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i sems mtshan ma med pa don tsam 'dzin pa la zhugs pas dngos po de la lan mang du gnas par gyis shig / de ltar byas pa dang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rigs pas
translated: If you do so, you will attain the wisdom of the tathāgatas through the reasoning of meditative absorption.

original: sems rtse gcig pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: You will attain one-pointedness of mind.

original: khyod gal te mi sdug pa yid la byed pa na yang yid la byed pa 'di nyid ma btang shig / gal te byams pa'am /
analyzed: khyod gal te mi sdug pa yid la byed pa na yang yid la byed pa 'di nyid ma btang shig / gal te byams pa'am /
translated: If you are practicing the contemplation of repulsiveness, do not give up this contemplation. If you are practicing loving kindness,

original: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / khams rab tu dbye ba dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / rngub pa dran pa dang / bsam gtan dang po nas rgyas par 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang /
analyzed: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / khams rab tu dbye ba dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / rngub pa dran pa dang / bsam gtan dang po nas rgyas par 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang /
translated: the knowledge of the path of dependent origination, the classification of the elements, mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, the first concentration, and so forth, up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa tshad med pa'i bar du yid la byed pa na yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa tshad med pa'i bar du yid la byed pa na yang /
translated: the bodhisattva concentrations, superknowledges, meditative stabilizations, and immeasurable meditative absorptions,

original: yid la byed pa 'di nyid ma btang shig / de ltar byas na khyod kyi byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa 'di mthar gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gdams ngag ston
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di nyid ma btang shig / de ltar byas na khyod kyi byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa 'di mthar gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gdams ngag ston
translated: If you do so, then this attention of a bodhisattva of yours will gradually come forth up to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: par mdzad do //
analyzed: par mdzad do //
translated: He teaches the instruction in this way.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be known as the bodhisattvas’ path that goes everywhere.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po la de ltar gdams so ;
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po la de ltar gdams so ;
translated: The tathāgatas of the past also instructed the beginner bodhisattvas in this way.

original: / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang de ltar 'doms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang de ltar 'doms par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the future they will also instruct in this way.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang de ltar 'doms so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na yang de ltar 'doms so //
translated: In the present they also instruct in this way.

original: gal te nyan thos kyang yid la byed pa 'dis sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: gal te nyan thos kyang yid la byed pa 'dis sbyor bar byed la /
translated: If a śrāvaka also practices with this attention,

original: yid la byed pa 'di ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par gyur na ni chos rnams mngon par rtogs par bya ba la mngon par @204a * //
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par gyur na ni chos rnams mngon par rtogs par bya ba la mngon par @204a * //
translated: If one realizes mental attention as it is, one realizes phenomena.

original: shes pa shin tu myur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa shin tu myur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands the mental attentions just as they are, then one will have very quick superknowledge in the realization of the Dharma.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to /
translated: By the power of knowledge of the path that leads everywhere, the Tathāgata knows, just as it is, the path that leads out of all suffering and the path that does not lead out.

original: // / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lam spangs nas nges par 'byung ba'i lam sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: // / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i lam spangs nas nges par 'byung ba'i lam sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: Having abandoned the path that does not lead out, he practices the path that leads out.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi mtha'i rjes de lta bu byung ba dang / skyes pa'i rabs rnams dgongs shing 'dul ba rnams kyi sems skyo bar bya ba dang / sems dad par bya ba'i phyir ston te /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi mtha'i rjes de lta bu byung ba dang / skyes pa'i rabs rnams dgongs shing 'dul ba rnams kyi sems skyo bar bya ba dang / sems dad par bya ba'i phyir ston te /
translated: By the power of knowing the recollection of past lives, the Tathagata recollects his former abodes, his former births, and he teaches them in order to inspire his disciples with sadness and faith.

original: rtag par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //🔽'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos las brtsams te /
analyzed: rtag par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do // 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos las brtsams te /
translated: He also refutes the ascetics and Brahmins who are eternalists.

original: 'das pa'i dus na shi ba'i dus byas pa dang / skye ba yang lung ston pa /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na shi ba'i dus byas pa dang / skye ba yang lung ston pa /
translated: By the power of knowing death and rebirth, the Tathagata knows the deaths and rebirths of the disciples and so forth.

original: chad par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
analyzed: chad par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad do //
translated: He also refutes the ascetics and Brahmins who are annihilationists.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa la yang som nyi mi mnga' zhing /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa la yang som nyi mi mnga' zhing /
translated: By the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements, the Tathagata has no doubt about his own liberation.

original: the tshom mi mnga' la /
analyzed: the tshom mi mnga' la /
translated: He is free from doubt.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dzin pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid du mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'dzin pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyang tshar gcod par mdzad de /
translated: He also refutes the śramaṇas and brahmins who are full of pride about their arhatship.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the activity of the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag gi go rims gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag gi go rims gang zhe na /
translated: What is the order of these ten powers of the tathāgatas?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pas stobs bcu thams cad cig car brnyes te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pas stobs bcu thams cad cig car brnyes te /
translated: Immediately after fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, the Tathāgata obtains all ten powers at once.

original: cig car brnyes nas kyang de dag rim gyis mngon sum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: cig car brnyes nas kyang de dag rim gyis mngon sum du 'gyur te /
translated: Having obtained them at once, he subsequently realizes them one by one.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi mod la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid kyi mod la /
translated: Immediately after fully awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa la legs pa kho nar rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis chos rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa la legs pa kho nar rnam par gzigs so //
translated: The Tathagata, by the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible, sees perfectly the establishment of causes and effects of phenomena.

original: rnam par gzigs nas 'dod pa'i khams nyid du skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kyi sdug pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams la ni las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis mi dge ba'i las @204b yongs su spangs pa dang / dge ba'i las spyod par bya ba rnam par ston to //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs nas 'dod pa'i khams nyid du skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kyi sdug pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par 'dod pa rnams la ni las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis mi dge ba'i las @204b yongs su spangs pa dang / dge ba'i las spyod par bya ba rnam par ston to //
translated: Having seen, he teaches the abandonment of non-virtuous actions and the practice of virtuous actions to those who desire the special result of the attractive realm of the desire realm, by the power of knowledge of the results of actions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la ni /
translated: To worldly beings who are free from desire,

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bar bya ba dang / ji lta ba bzhin du lam thob par bya ba'i gdams ngag sbyin par mdzad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bar bya ba dang / ji lta ba bzhin du lam thob par bya ba'i gdams ngag sbyin par mdzad do //
translated: By the power of knowing the absorptions, the liberations, and entering the concentrations, he gives instructions for attaining the mundane freedom from attachment and for attaining the path just as it is.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams la ni de ma yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bdun gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i lam rnam par ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams la ni de ma yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bdun gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i lam rnam par ston to //
translated: For those who desire the supramundane freedom from attachment, he teaches the path to the supramundane freedom from attachment through the other seven powers of the Tathagata.

original: de la thog mar ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams kyi dbang po rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: de la thog mar ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams kyi dbang po rnam par gzigs so //
translated: First, by the power of knowing the superior and non-superior faculties, he sees the faculties of those who desire the supramundane freedom from attachment.

original: de'i 'og tu mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni dbang po sngon du 'gro ba'i bsam pa la rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni dbang po sngon du 'gro ba'i bsam pa la rnam par gzigs so //
translated: Then, by the power of knowledge of the variety of interests, he sees the thoughts preceded by the faculties.

original: de'i 'og tu khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bag la nyal rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i bag la nyal rnam par gzigs so //
translated: Then, by the power of knowledge of the variety of elements, he sees the proclivities preceded by the thoughts.

original: de ltar dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal mkhyen pa des /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal mkhyen pa des /
translated: Thus, by knowing the faculties, the thoughts, and the proclivities,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ci rigs par dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo rnams la 'dzud par mdzad do //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ci rigs par dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo rnams la 'dzud par mdzad do //
translated: by the power of knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere, he causes them to enter the doors of service with regard to the objects.

original: de'i 'og tu yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma'i dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo'i sbyor ba sems gnas pa yang 'dzin du 'jug la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir mtshan ma'i dmigs pa la 'jug pa'i sgo'i sbyor ba sems gnas pa yang 'dzin du 'jug la /
translated: Then, by the power of knowledge of recollecting former abodes and by the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, he causes them to take up the practice of fixing the mind on the doors of service with regard to the objects that are the signs, in order to abandon all the defilements.

original: spyod pa rnams kyang rnam par dag par mdzad nas /
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyang rnam par dag par mdzad nas /
translated: He also purifies their conduct.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba dang rtag pa dang / chad pa dang mthar 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'i dbu ma'i lam rnam par ston to //🔽de'i 'og tu de ltar yang dag par brtson zhing zhi gnas kyis nye bar brten te /

analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ces bya ste /
translated: This is called the Tathagata's nature of non-forgetfulness.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad dang / yul thams cad dang / mdzad pa'i thabs thams cad dang / dus thams cad du bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad dang / yul thams cad dang / mdzad pa'i thabs thams cad dang / dus thams cad du bsnyel ba mi mnga' ste /
translated: Thus, the Tathagata is never forgetful of all his activities, all his objects, all his skillful means, and all the times.

original: rtag tu dgongs pa nye bar gnas pa 'di ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dgongs pa nye bar gnas pa 'di ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be seen as the nature of non-forgetfulness, always remaining in mindfulness.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bskyod pa'am /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bskyod pa'am /
translated: Here, the Tathagata's shaking,

original: gzigs pa'am / srung ba'am /

translated: seeing, protecting,

analyzed: gnas pa la nyon mongs pa mnga' ba 'dra ba'i kun du spyod pa mi mnga' ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The fact that the Tathagata does not have the conduct of possessing afflictions in his abiding is called the Tathagata's complete destruction of the propensities.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin mod kyi /🔽gzigs pa'am / srung ba'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin mod kyi / gzigs pa'am / srung ba'am /
translated: Arhats have abandoned the afflictions,🔽but they still have the conduct, movements,

original: nyon mongs pa yod pa 'dra ba'i spyod pa dang / bskyod pa dang / lta ba dang / smra ba dang / gnas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yod pa 'dra ba'i spyod pa dang / bskyod pa dang / lta ba dang / smra ba dang / gnas pa yang yod do //
translated: views, speech, and abiding that resemble the existence of afflictions.

original: mdor bsdu na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos rnams kyi tshogs gsum mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /🔽gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos rnams kyi tshogs gsum mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te / gsum gang zhe na /
translated: In brief, the Tathagata has fully awakened to the three categories of phenomena:

original: don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams dang / don dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnam pa dang / don dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams dang / don dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnam pa dang / don dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: those that are meaningful, those that are not meaningful, and those that are neither meaningful nor not meaningful.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i don dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / don @208b dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i don dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / don @208b dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all things that are not endowed with meaning, that are endowed with meaning, and that are neither endowed with meaning nor not endowed with meaning is called the Tathāgata’s knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i don dang ldan pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchog mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i don dang ldan pa'i chos thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchog mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all things that are endowed with meaning is called the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the most sublime.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa dang / mchog mkhyen pa gang yin pa de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa dang / mchog mkhyen pa gang yin pa de gnyis gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects and the knowledge of the most sublime are combined into one, called the knowledge of all aspects and the most sublime.

original: de dag thams cad bsdoms pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsdoms pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu yin no //
translated: All of these combined are the one hundred and forty unique qualities of a buddha.

original: de la mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams ni byang chub sems dpar gyur pa des srid pa tha ma la shin tu yongs su dag par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams ni byang chub sems dpar gyur pa des srid pa tha ma la shin tu yongs su dag par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The major and minor marks are attained in a completely pure form by the bodhisattva in his final existence.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs te /
translated: When the bodhisattva is seated at the site of awakening,🔽he has completely perfected the path of the accumulations for awakening.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs kyi lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa des ni srid pa tha ma de'i tshe slob dpon med par phyi ma la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs kyi lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa des ni srid pa tha ma de'i tshe slob dpon med par phyi ma la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms nas /
translated: Without a teacher, he cultivates the thirty-seven factors of awakening and, in that final existence,

analyzed: skad cig gcig gis sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur te /
translated: he attains the meditative absorption called “bestowing unobstructed pristine awareness.”

original: slob par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin tu gtogs pa de'i mjug thogs su skad cig gnyis pa la lhag ma stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa la thugs shin tu
analyzed: slob par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin tu gtogs pa de'i mjug thogs su skad cig gnyis pa la lhag ma stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnam pa thams cad dang mchog mkhyen pa la thugs shin tu
translated: Immediately after the vajra-like samadhi of the bodhisattva who is still in training, in the second instant, he simultaneously attains the remaining qualities of the Buddha, such as the ten powers, etc., the knowledge of all aspects and the supreme knowledge, which are extremely

original: rnam par dag cing bla na med pa rnams cig car thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag cing bla na med pa rnams cig car thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: pure and unsurpassed.

original: de dag thob pas chags pa med cing sgrib pa med la shin tu rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa'i ye shes btsal ba tsam la thogs pa med pa shes bya thams cad la 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag thob pas chags pa med cing sgrib pa med la shin tu rnam par dag cing dri ma med pa'i ye shes btsal ba tsam la thogs pa med pa shes bya thams cad la 'jug go //
translated: By attaining these, he penetrates all objects of knowledge without obstruction, with a mere wish, with unattached, unobstructed, extremely pure, stainless knowledge.

original: brnag pa yang yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: brnag pa yang yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: And he fulfills his vow.

original: de ltar thugs la dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa las yang dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: de ltar thugs la dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa las yang dag par 'das nas /
translated: Thus, having fulfilled his intention, he transcends the bodhisattva stages and the bodhisattva way of life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la bzhugs pa yin no //🔽shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len snying po yod pa lta bu @209a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la bzhugs pa yin no // shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gnas ngan len snying po yod pa lta bu @209a * //
translated: He is engaged in the activities of the Tathagata and he is established in the stage of the Tathagata.

original: yang ma lus par spangs nas de'i gnas gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ma lus par spangs nas de'i gnas gyur pa yin no //
translated: The transformation of the basis is the removal of the obscuration that consists in the knowable in its entirety, together with the latent impressions of the notional attachment to the apprehended object and apprehending subject.🔽The transformation of the basis is the removal of the obscuration that consists in the knowable in its entirety, together with the latent impressions of the notional attachment to the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i gnas gyur pa de ni bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i gnas gyur pa de ni bla na med pa yin no //
translated: That transformation of the basis is unsurpassed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa mchog la thug pa man chad rnams kyi gnas gyur pa gzhan thams cad ni bla na med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa mchog la thug pa man chad rnams kyi gnas gyur pa gzhan thams cad ni bla na med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: All other transformations of the basis of the bodhisattvas, down to the supreme stage, should be known as being surpassed.

original: de la mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes khyad par yod pa ye shes ji lta bu zhig gis bye brag tu gyur par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes khyad par yod pa ye shes ji lta bu zhig gis bye brag tu gyur par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What kind of gnosis is the difference between the bodhisattva who is on the stage that goes to the end and the gnosis of the Tathagata?

original: 'di la mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la mig dang ldan pa seng ras kyis bar du chod pa'i gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes ni shes bya thams cad la mig dang ldan pa seng ras kyis bar du chod pa'i gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattva who is on the stage that leads to the ultimate should be known as being like a person who has eyes but whose vision is obstructed by a veil.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni cis kyang bar du mchod pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni cis kyang bar du mchod pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the Tathāgata should be regarded as being like a person who has eyes and is not obstructed by anything.

original: dper na ri mo rnam pa thams cad du tshon tshang bar bkye la /🔽mjug gi tshon gyis gcad pa shin tu rnam par dag pas yongs su dag par ma byas pa dang 'dra bar ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i ye shes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na ri mo rnam pa thams cad du tshon tshang bar bkye la / mjug gi tshon gyis gcad pa shin tu rnam par dag pas yongs su dag par ma byas pa dang 'dra bar ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i ye shes blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is like a painting in which all the colors are complete,🔽but the final touches with the colors have not been applied, so that it is not completely pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni shin tu rnam par dag par byas pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni shin tu rnam par dag par byas pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the Tathāgata should be regarded as being like a painting in which the final touches with the colors have been applied, so that it is completely pure.

original: dper na mig dang ldan pa'i mi mun pa mi gnag pa'i nang na gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na mig dang ldan pa'i mi mun pa mi gnag pa'i nang na gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: For example, a person with eyes sees forms in a dark place, as in the previous example, the bodhisattva is like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rnam pa thams cad du mun pa med pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni rnam pa thams cad du mun pa med pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the Tathāgata should be seen as being like the complete absence of darkness, as in the previous example.

original: dper na mig dang ldan pa thag ring po nas gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig dang ldan pa thag ring po nas gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra bar ni byang chub sems dpa'i snga ma bzhin no //
translated: For example, a person with eyes sees forms from a distance, as in the previous example, the bodhisattva is like that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni nye ba nas lta ba dang 'dra ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni nye ba nas lta ba dang 'dra ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is like seeing from near, as in the previous example.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ni rab rib tshabs chung du gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ni rab rib tshabs chung du gzugs la lta ba dang 'dra ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is like a person with slight cataracts seeing forms, as in the previous example.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni mig shin tu rnam par dag pa dang 'dra ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni mig shin tu rnam par dag pa dang 'dra ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is like extremely clear vision, as in the previous example.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mngal na 'dug pa'i lus dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni mngal na 'dug pa'i lus dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage that leads to the ultimate should be seen as being like the body in the womb.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i srid par skye ba'i lus dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i srid par skye ba'i lus dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata should be seen as being like the body in the birth existence.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi sems kyi rgyu ba ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni mthar thug par 'gro @209b ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rmi lam gyi sems kyi rgyu ba ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni mthar thug par 'gro @209b ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i blta bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage that leads to the ultimate should be seen as being like the movement of the mind in the dream of an arhat.

original: de nyid sad pa'i sems kyi rgyu ba ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sad pa'i sems kyi rgyu ba ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata should be seen as being like the movement of the mind of one who is awake.

original: mar me rnam par ma dag pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar me rnam par ma dag pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: The nature of the wisdom of the bodhisattva who is on the stage that leads to the ultimate should be seen as being like the nature of a lamp that is not pure.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mar me'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mar me'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba de lta bur ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin blta bar bya ste /
translated: The nature of the Tathāgata’s gnosis should be seen as being like the nature of a very pure lamp.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dang mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnyis ni ye shes kyi khyad par dang / sku'i khyad par dang / dgongs pa'i khyad par khyad che bar reg par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa dang mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gnyis ni ye shes kyi khyad par dang / sku'i khyad par dang / dgongs pa'i khyad par khyad che bar reg par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata and the bodhisattva who is established in the stage that goes to the end should be known to differ greatly in terms of the difference in their gnosis, the difference in their bodies, and the difference in their intentions.

original: de ltar byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad mdzad do //
translated: The Tathāgata, having fully awakened to enlightenment, performs all the activities of a Buddha in all the Buddha-fields of the ten directions.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the activities of a Buddha?

original: mdor bsdu na bcu po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las su mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bcu po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las su mdzad pa yin te /
translated: In brief, these ten are the deeds and actions of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa re re yang sems can tshad med pa dag gi don mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa re re yang sems can tshad med pa dag gi don mdzad pa yin te /
translated: Each of the deeds of the Tathagatas accomplishes the aims of immeasurable sentient beings.

original: de las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: de las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: de las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: thog ma kho nar bdag nyid kyi skyes bu chen po'i sku la sems dga' bar byed /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar bdag nyid kyi skyes bu chen po'i sku la sems dga' bar byed /
translated: First, he delights his own mind with the body of a great man.

original: skyes bu chen po'i dngos po la yid ches pa bskyed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa dang po ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i dngos po la yid ches pa bskyed pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa dang po ste /
translated: He generates confidence in the reality of the great man. This is the first deed of the Tathagata.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: The Tathagata accomplishes it with his major and minor marks.

original: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du gdams pa'i sbyor ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du gdams pa'i sbyor ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: The application of all the instructions to all sentient beings is the second deed of the Tathagata.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhis sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhis sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: The Tathāgata accomplishes it through the four thorough purifications in all respects.

original: de sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa byed nus pa dang / the tshom thams cad gcod nus pa ni /
analyzed: de sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa byed nus pa dang / the tshom thams cad gcod nus pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata’s ability to fulfill the needs of all sentient beings and to resolve all their doubts

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa gsum pa ste /🔽de ni de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs @210a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa gsum pa ste / de ni de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs @210a * //
translated: is the third deed of a Tathāgata.

original: pa'i stobs bcus sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa'i stobs bcus sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: The Tathāgata accomplishes it through the ten powers of a Tathāgata.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i stobs bcu po dag gis sems can rnams kyi don sgrub par spyod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngar bstan pa'i stobs bcu po dag gis sems can rnams kyi don sgrub par spyod de /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata accomplishes the welfare of sentient beings through the ten powers that were previously described.

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu las brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu las brtsams te /
translated: When someone asks a question to the Tathāgata that is based on the ten powers of a Tathāgata,

original: de la zhus na ji ltar gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa dang / gzigs pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par mkhyen pa de ltar de dag de bzhin gshegs pas de dag gi zhu ba zhus pa lan 'debs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de la zhus na ji ltar gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen pa dang / gzigs pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par mkhyen pa de ltar de dag de bzhin gshegs pas de dag gi zhu ba zhus pa lan 'debs par mdzad do //
translated: the Tathāgata responds to that question in a manner that accords with the way those questions are known, seen, distinguished, and understood by a Tathāgata.

original: pha rol gyi smra ba thams cad tshar gcod cing rang gi gzhung 'dzugs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bzhi pa ste /

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: This is accomplished by the Tathāgata through his forms of fearlessness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa la gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i gdul ba rnams la yang thugs kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa lnga pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa la gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa'i gdul ba rnams la yang thugs kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth deed of the Tathāgata is to be free of any afflicted thought toward those who are being disciplined by the Tathāgata, whether or not they abide in his teachings.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: This is accomplished by the Tathāgata through his forms of mindfulness.

original: ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du mdzad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa drug pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du mdzad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa drug pa ste /
translated: The sixth deed of the Tathāgata is to do just what he says.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bsrung ba med pa rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bsrung ba med pa rnams kyis sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: This is accomplished by the Tathāgata through his forms of awareness that are not subject to error.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis nyin mtshan du 'jig rten thams cad la rnam par gzigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bdun pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis nyin mtshan du 'jig rten thams cad la rnam par gzigs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bdun pa ste /
translated: The Buddha’s eye constantly and always sees the entire world with its seven stations of beings.

analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas thugs rje chen pos sgrub par mdzad do // sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad las mi nyams pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa brgyad pa ste /
translated: This is the seventh deed of the Tathāgata, which he accomplishes through his great compassion.🔽The Tathāgata never fails to do what should be done for all sentient beings.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid kyis sgrub par mdzad do //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su blangs shing nyams su spyad par bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa dgu pa ste /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid kyis sgrub par mdzad do // de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du nyams su blangs shing nyams su spyad par bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa dgu pa ste /
translated: This is the eighth deed of the Tathāgata, which he accomplishes through his quality of being unforgetful.🔽The Tathāgata’s way of life is to be practiced and followed.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bag chags yang dag par bcom pas sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas bag chags yang dag par bcom pas sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: This is the ninth deed of the Tathāgata, which he accomplishes through his destruction of the traces.

original: chos gang don dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / gang don @210b dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams gtan spangs nas /
analyzed: chos gang don dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / gang don @210b dang ldan pa yang ma yin don dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams gtan spangs nas /
translated: Having completely abandoned those teachings that are not meaningful and those that are neither meaningful nor meaningless,

original: chos gang don dang ldan pa de dag yang dag par ston cing 'grel la gsal bar mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: chos gang don dang ldan pa de dag yang dag par ston cing 'grel la gsal bar mdzad pa ni /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bcu pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bcu pa ste /

analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa thams cad dang / mchog mkhyen pas sgrub par mdzad de / de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgya bzhi bcu po 'di dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bcu mdzad cing /
translated: This is accomplished by the Tathāgata through his knowledge of all aspects and of the most sublime states.

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las thams cad mdzad do //
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata performs the ten deeds of a tathāgata through these one hundred and forty unique qualities of a buddha and accomplishes all the activities of a buddha.

translated: A detailed analysis of these would not be easy even in a hundred million eons.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'di ni rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa 'di ni rab tu gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the abiding of the Tathagata, and this stage of the Tathagata is called the 'Abiding'.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: But when the counterfeit Dharma does spread, from that time on the true Dharma, which is truly meaningful, will decline.

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med na mi skyo bar bya ba'i thabs rnyed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis rgyas par gyur na /

translated: The method of applying oneself to one’s own and others’ aims, the method of being without defilements, the method of not being discouraged, the method of increasing the roots of virtue, and the method of accomplishing the attainment of enlightenment🔽are as follows:
