translated: Having sought them, one teaches them to others.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang nan tan gyis sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang nan tan gyis sgrub par byed do //
translated: And one practices them oneself.

original: bsgrubs nas kyang gang gis dang / gang du dang / gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba des der de'i phyir sgrub po //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas kyang gang gis dang / gang du dang / gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba des der de'i phyir sgrub po //
translated: Having practiced them, one practices with whatever is to be practiced, wherever it is to be practiced, and for whatever purpose it is to be practiced.

original: des der de'i phyir sgrub pa na ci nas bsod nams sogs pa dang / ye shes sogs par gyur pa de lta bur sgrub po //
analyzed: des der de'i phyir sgrub pa na ci nas bsod nams sogs pa dang / ye shes sogs par gyur pa de lta bur sgrub po //
translated: He practices in such a way that he will have merit and wisdom.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes bsags nas 'khor ba mi spang ba'i tha bas sgrub po //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes bsags nas 'khor ba mi spang ba'i tha bas sgrub po //
translated: Having accumulated merit and wisdom, he practices without abandoning the life-cycle.

original: de la sgrub pa na 'khor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sgrub bo //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa na 'khor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med par sgrub bo //
translated: Practicing thus, he practices without the defilement of the life-cycle.

original: de la sgrub pa ni bdag gi bde ba la lhag par chags pa med par sgrub po //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni bdag gi bde ba la lhag par chags pa med par sgrub po //
translated: Practicing thus, he practices without attachment to his own happiness.

original: de la sgrub pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi skyo bar sgrub po //🔽des yongs su mi skyon bstan bcos rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi skyo bar sgrub po // des yongs su mi skyon bstan bcos rnams la brten nas /
translated: Practicing thus, he practices without being discouraged by the suffering of the life-cycle.🔽He is not discouraged because he has learned the treatises.

original: bstan bcos thams cad la mi 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad la mi 'jigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having learned the treatises, he is fearless with regard to all the treatises.

original: bstan bcos shes na su la gang ci ltar bstan par bya ba de shes pas /🔽'jig rten shes par @212a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos shes na su la gang ci ltar bstan par bya ba de shes pas / 'jig rten shes par @212a * //
translated: Knowing the treatises, he knows what to teach, to whom, and how.🔽Thus he knows the world.

original: 'gyur ro // de ltar bstan bcos shes shing 'jig rten shes na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de ltar bstan bcos shes shing 'jig rten shes na /
translated: Knowing the treatises and knowing the world,

original: tshul bzhin du chos rnams yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du chos rnams yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: He seeks the Dharma in the right way.

original: de ltar tshol bas sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshol bas sems can thams cad kyi the tshom thams cad gcod nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By seeking in this way, he is able to cut through all the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar nus na gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pas bsod nams kyis mngon par skye zhing bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar nus na gzhan gyi the tshom gcod pas bsod nams kyis mngon par skye zhing bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: If he is able to do this, then by cutting through the doubts of others, he is born through merit and perfects the equipment of merit.

original: bdag nyid kyang ye shes las mngon par skye bas ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang ye shes las mngon par skye bas ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: And because he is born through wisdom, he perfects the equipment of wisdom.

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs na bden pa'i rnam pas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa la sbyor bar 'gyur zhing bsgom pa'i thabs rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs na bden pa'i rnam pas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos bsgom pa la sbyor bar 'gyur zhing bsgom pa'i thabs rab tu shes so //
translated: When the equipment is perfected, he is engaged in the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment through the aspects of the truths and knows the means of cultivation.

original: de ltar brtson na bsgom pa des theg pa chen po'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das par yongs su sngo bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar brtson na bsgom pa des theg pa chen po'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das par yongs su sngo bar byed de /
translated: When he is thus striving, he dedicates that cultivation to the great vehicle’s parinirvāṇa.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the vehicle of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar thabs la mkhas pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis gsungs pa thos pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar thabs la mkhas pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis gsungs pa thos pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, through skillful means, he hears what is taught by all the buddhas and bodhisattvas and retains it.

original: sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa'i stobs kyis de la rnam pa thams cad du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa'i stobs kyis de la rnam pa thams cad du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And through the power of meditation, all the Dharmas that he has not heard previously become manifest to him.

original: de la gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis dmigs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir sgrub bo //
analyzed: de la gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyis dmigs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir sgrub bo //
translated: There, through the three doors of liberation, he accomplishes the relinquishment of all objective supports, endowed with retention and eloquence.

original: de la sgrub na bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi phyin ci log gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal spong ba la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sgrub na bdag dang gzhan rnams kyi phyin ci log gi mngon pa'i nga rgyal spong ba la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: When he accomplishes that, he engages in the relinquishment of the false pride of self and other.

original: 'di ni de'i rnam pa thams cad du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i rnam pa thams cad du sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is his complete accomplishment of all aspects.

original: de ltar zhugs pa de ni sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / phan yon gyi yon tan gyi khyad par gyis sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa de ni sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang / phan yon gyi yon tan gyi khyad par gyis sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has entered this path is superior to all sentient beings, to the śrāvakas, and to the pratyekabuddhas because of the excellence of the qualities of practice and because of the excellence of the qualities of benefit.

original: de la sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dag gzhan gyi don rang gis dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dag gzhan gyi don rang gis dgos pa yin te /
translated: The excellence of the qualities of practice is as follows. The bodhisattva has entered for the sake of benefiting both self and other.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni de ltar gzhan gyi don bdag gis dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni de ltar gzhan gyi don bdag gis dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not have such a practice for the sake of others.

original: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is impartial toward all sentient beings.

original: sems snyoms pas na rtag tu phan 'dogs pa'i phyir 'jug la /
analyzed: sems snyoms pas na rtag tu phan 'dogs pa'i phyir 'jug la /
translated: Because of this impartiality, he always engages in benefiting them.

original: lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med do //
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med do //
translated: He does not expect to be benefited in return.

original: de ltar brtson @212b pa ni rtag tu de dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar brtson @212b pa ni rtag tu de dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the one who is so engaged always desires their benefit and happiness.

original: de ltar phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la 'bras bu yod par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni de dag la 'bras bu yod par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Thus, one who has the thought of benefit and happiness applies himself to the existence of their result.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni gong nas gong du sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni gong nas gong du sgrub pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par bsgrubs so //
translated: Thus, he establishes the excellence of the qualities of practice in a higher and higher way.

original: de la phan yon gyi yon tan gyi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas rnams lung bstan pa thob kyi /
analyzed: de la phan yon gyi yon tan gyi khyad par ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas rnams lung bstan pa thob kyi /
translated: Therein, the excellence of the quality of benefit is that the Bodhisattva obtains the prophecy of Buddhahood,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas.

original: lung bstan na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung bstan na phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Having obtained the prophecy, he abides in the stage of nonregression.

original: de la gnas na nges par bya ba dang / rtag tu bya dgos pa la brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas na nges par bya ba dang / rtag tu bya dgos pa la brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding therein, he obtains the nature of nonforgetfulness with regard to what must be done and what must be done constantly.

original: de ltar brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar brjed pa med pa'i chos nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: Thus, having become one who has the nature of nonforgetfulness,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gdags pas 'dogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu gdags pas 'dogs par mdzad do //
translated: he is designated by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas as the foremost of all beings.

original: bya ba thams cad kyang yongs su nyams par mi byed do //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad kyang yongs su nyams par mi byed do //
translated: He does not let any of his activities decline.

original: ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not decline through the loss of what has not been attained.

original: yongs su ma nyams na rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rtag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su ma nyams na rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rtag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he does not decline, he always and uninterruptedly increases in virtuous qualities.

original: zla ba yar gyi ngo bzhin du skye ba na yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba yar gyi ngo bzhin du skye ba na yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpar 'gyur te /
translated: When he increases, he becomes a true bodhisattva, like the waxing moon.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ltar bcos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ltar bcos pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not a counterfeit bodhisattva.

original: yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur na rnam pa thams cad du 'dul ba'i thabs thams cad shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur na rnam pa thams cad du 'dul ba'i thabs thams cad shes so //
translated: When he becomes a true bodhisattva, he knows all the methods of training in all their aspects.

original: shes par gyur na gang la yongs su btsal ba dang / gang yongs su btsal ba dang / gang gis yongs su btsal ba rnam par gzhag pa thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes par gyur na gang la yongs su btsal ba dang / gang yongs su btsal ba dang / gang gis yongs su btsal ba rnam par gzhag pa thams cad la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he knows them, he becomes skilled in all the principles of what is to be sought, what is to be sought through what, and what is to be sought for what purpose.

original: yongs su bcal ba yang gang gis mthar thug par gyur pa de rnam par 'jog par mdzad do //
analyzed: yongs su bcal ba yang gang gis mthar thug par gyur pa de rnam par 'jog par mdzad do //
translated: And the one who has fully investigated and has reached the ultimate is the one who is said to be established.

original: rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas na gdams ngag la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa la mkhas na gdams ngag la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is skilled in the establishment of the Dharma, one becomes skilled in the instructions.

original: gdams ngag la mkhas pa na dmigs pa tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdams ngag la mkhas pa na dmigs pa tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is skilled in the instructions, one attains the king of samādhis, which has immeasurable objects.

original: ting nge 'dzin de thob pas 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de thob pas 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: By attaining that samādhi, one teaches the Dharma that has results.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston pa 'bras bu dang bcas par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyis ston pa 'bras bu dang bcas par byed do //
translated: One makes the teaching fruitful through various aspects.

original: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will also attain deliverance through the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung na theg pa chen po sdud par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung na theg pa chen po sdud par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When one attains deliverance through the Great Vehicle, one will also gather the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba'i gnas @213a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung ba'i gnas @213a * //
translated: The stage of attaining deliverance through the Great Vehicle

original: skabs de dang der ming de dang de thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skabs de dang der ming de dang de thob par 'gyur la /
translated: is the stage where one attains that name.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang /
translated: All the world, and the Buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang thun mong du gyur pa'i ming 'dogs shing bstod par yang mdzad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang thun mong du gyur pa'i ming 'dogs shing bstod par yang mdzad de /
translated: give the bodhisattva a name that is shared in common with all bodhisattvas and praise him.

original: 'di dag ni phan yon gyi khyad par yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan yon gyi khyad par yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the distinctive benefits.

original: de lta bu'i ming can ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtags rnams yin te rtags gang dag gis rtags de dang ldan na sgrub pa de khyim pa'i phyogs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la yang rnam pa thams cad du sgrub par byed do//
analyzed: de lta bu'i ming can ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtags rnams yin te rtags gang dag gis rtags de dang ldan na sgrub pa de khyim pa'i phyogs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la yang rnam pa thams cad du sgrub par byed do//
translated: These are the signs of a bodhisattva, the signs by which one who possesses them is a bodhisattva.

original: gnyi ga'i phyogs la yang sgrub par byed na sgrub pa snying por byed pa gcig tu nges par dge ba'i phyogs la lhag pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyogs la yang sgrub par byed na sgrub pa snying por byed pa gcig tu nges par dge ba'i phyogs la lhag pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: If one practices in both the lay and ordained segments, one is certain to be virtuous and have a superior attitude toward the virtuous.🔽With such an attitude, one will either remain a householder for life,

original: de lta bu'i bsam pas ji srid gnas kyi bar du khyim pa yongs su gzung ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pas ji srid gnas kyi bar du khyim pa yongs su gzung ba'am /
translated: With such an attitude, one should maintain the householder's life for as long as one is able.

original: rab tu byung ba yongs su gzung ba dge ba'i phyogs la 'dzud par byed do ;
analyzed: rab tu byung ba yongs su gzung ba dge ba'i phyogs la 'dzud par byed do ;
translated: He takes up the life of a renunciate and introduces him to the side of virtue.

original: / de phyin chad ni gang du sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ba dang / sems can gyi don du bsams bzhin du skye ba 'dzin to //
analyzed: / de phyin chad ni gang du sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ba dang / sems can gyi don du bsams bzhin du skye ba 'dzin to //
translated: From then on, he is always in the company of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas and he takes up birth as he wishes for the sake of beings.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gdams ngag gis nye bar brten te dge ba'i phyogs kyi khyad par thob pa'i gnas skabs nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par gdams ngag gis nye bar brten te dge ba'i phyogs kyi khyad par thob pa'i gnas skabs nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There, the Buddhas and bodhisattvas always and uninterruptedly give him advice and he experiences the state of attaining the special virtues.

original: de nyams su myong ba'i phan yon gzung bas khyad par thob pa'i gnas skabs der khyim gyi tshul gyis 'jug go //
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i phan yon gzung bas khyad par thob pa'i gnas skabs der khyim gyi tshul gyis 'jug go //
translated: He takes up the state of attainment of the special virtues by the benefit of that experience and he enters into the householder’s way of life.

original: gnas skabs der blo gnas na gong nas gong du mthar thug par 'gro ba'i bar du khyad par gyi gnas skabs rnams la rnam pa thams cad du rtul bar byed cing chog mi shes so //
analyzed: gnas skabs der blo gnas na gong nas gong du mthar thug par 'gro ba'i bar du khyad par gyi gnas skabs rnams la rnam pa thams cad du rtul bar byed cing chog mi shes so //
translated: At that stage, if the mind remains, one is completely devoted to the special stages, from the higher to the ultimate, and is never satisfied.

original: de ltar brtul na mthar thug pa'i gnas thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar brtul na mthar thug pa'i gnas thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If one is devoted in that way, one will attain the ultimate stage.

original: de phyin chad yang yongs su btsal du med de bla na med pa thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de phyin chad yang yongs su btsal du med de bla na med pa thob pa yin no //
translated: From then on, there is nothing more to seek, and one attains the unsurpassed.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i go rims rdzogs so /
translated: The Stages of the Bodhisattva is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian abbot Prajñāvarman and the chief editor and translator Bandé Yeshé Dé.

original: // / shlo ka drug stong bdun brgya lnga bcu yod do//
analyzed: // / shlo ka drug stong bdun brgya lnga bcu yod do//
translated: It has 6,750 ślokas.
